credentials: PHD 2003 Univ of Michigan at Ann Arbor
name: Andrea DUTTON

ratings.comment: Seemed nice. Only flaws in the class seemed to be because of the other professor. Lectures could be hard to follow at times, but may have just been the subject matter not being something I particularly care for.

I loved her class. Her lectures are really interesting and made me genuinely want to pursue geology as a second major. Workload is super manageable, with no exams or writing assignments, and it's not hard to do well. Definitely a low stress class. Plus, she's really accessible and down to earth. Couldn't recommend more!!
Very nice, accommodated me while I was having a hard time. Quiz and homework assignments every week along with a lab assignment. There were also assignments to reflect on every lecture that week.

I really enjoyed having her as my professor. I highly respect her and find her interesting to listen to. She is a queen and I would 10/10 recommend her class as an interesting and easy science credit.
She was great honestly. Everything on the weekly quizzes were covered in lectures. There were very few times I left the lecture confused. Great class and great professor.

I loved Prof. Dutton. The topic was incredibly interesting, she is very knowledgeable and experienced. Online textbook with a smartbook assignment every week as well as a 20 question quiz weekly. No exams and no final. Labs were fun and interesting, not hard to get good grades. Overall amazing person and intriguing subject.
